trans-unit.source: Provides a modal dialog box for editing the contents of a collection using a <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CollectionForm"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor"></xref> to use for editing the collection.
Indicates whether you can remove the original members of the collection.
When implemented in a derived class, this method indicates whether the specified value can be removed from the collection.
By default, this returns the value from <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CanRemoveInstance%2A> of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor> for this form.
This method is called when the user tries to remove from the collection an item that is an original member of the collection.
This method is not called when removing items that were added in this editing session, because they are not yet part of the collection.
The value to remove.
`true` if it is permissible to remove this value from the collection; otherwise, `false`.

By default, this method returns the value from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CanRemoveInstance(System.Object)"></xref> of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor"></xref> for this form.
Indicates whether multiple collection items can be selected at once.
This method indicates whether multiple collection members can be selected within the collection editor dialog box.
`true` if it multiple collection members can be selected at the same time; otherwise, `false`.

By default, this method returns the value from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CanSelectMultipleInstances"></xref> of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor"></xref> for this form.
Gets the data type of each item in the collection.
This property represents the data type of the items of the collection.
The data type of the collection items.
Gets the data type of the collection object.
This property represents the data type of the collection object.
The data type of the collection object.
Gets a type descriptor that indicates the current context.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that indicates the context currently in use, or `null` if no context is available.
Creates a new instance of the specified collection item type.
This method throws an exception if a new instance cannot be created.
If the user chooses to cancel the creation of this instance, this method returns `null`.
The type of item to create.
A new instance of the specified object, or `null` if the user chose to cancel the creation of this instance.
Destroys the specified instance of the object.
The object to destroy.
Displays the specified exception to the user.
The exception to display.
Gets or sets the collection object to edit.
The collection object to edit.
Gets the requested service, if it is available.
The type of service to retrieve.
An instance of the service, or `null` if the service cannot be found.
Gets or sets the array of items for this form to display.
The default implementation retrieves the current set of items from the `Item` property of the collection.
An array of objects for the form to display.
Gets the available item types that can be created for this collection.
This property indicates the data types that can be added to the collection.
By default, this returns a single type of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CollectionItemType%2A>.
If more than one type is returned, the collection editor UI provides a way to choose which item type to create.
The types of items that can be created.
Provides an opportunity to perform processing when a collection value has changed.
This method is raised when the value of a collection item has changed.
Shows the dialog box for the collection editor using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.IWindowsFormsEditorService"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.IWindowsFormsEditorService"></xref> that can be used to show the dialog box.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult"></xref> that indicates the result code returned from the dialog box.
